revision_history.draft:
The clock’s hands unspool like thread  
through the wall’s white plaster—  
a sparrow’s wing, once  
stitched to the frame, now  
frayed at the seam.  
Dust on the photo’s edge  
accumulates in ridges,  
a geography of neglect.  
Light fractures through the closed window,  
a prism of unspoken  
names.  
The coffee cup still warm  
holds the shape of a mouth,  
but the steam rises  
in a language the air  
has forgotten.

The clock’s hands unspool like thread  
through the wall’s white plaster—  
a sparrow’s wing, once  
stitched to the frame, now  
frayed at the seam.  
Dust on the photo’s edge  
accumulates in ridges,  
a geography of neglect.  
Light splinters through the closed window,  
a prism of silent names.  
The coffee cup, still warm,  
holds the shape of a mouth,  
but the steam rises  
in a language the air  
has forgotten.

final_poem:
The clock’s hands unspool like thread  
through the wall’s white plaster—  
a sparrow’s wing, once  
stitched to the frame, now  
frayed at the seam.  
Dust on the photo’s edge  
accumulates in ridges,  
a geography of neglect.  
Light splinters through the closed window,  
a mosaic of unspoken syllables.  
The coffee cup, still warm,  
cup’s curve cradles the ghost of a mouth,  
but steam rises—  
in a language the air  
has forgotten.
